title: FFmpeg School of Assembly Language
dot:
digraph FFmpegAssemblyLessonOne{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12];edge[fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];Title[label="FFmpeg Assembly Language Lesson One", shape=ellipse, fontsize=16, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];Introduction[label="Introduction
Welcome to FFmpeg Assembly Language School.
First step in a challenging yet rewarding journey.
Focus on SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data)."];RequiredKnowledge[label="Required Knowledge
1. C Programming (especially pointers)
2. High School Mathematics (scalar vs vector, etc.)"];WhatIsAssembly[label="What is Assembly Language?
Human-readable code â†’ Machine code.
SIMD: Process multiple data elements at once.
Used in FFmpeg for multimedia processing."];WhyAssembly[label="Why Write in Assembly?
10x+ speed improvement.
Essential for real-time video playback.
Energy efficiency and battery life."];FlavorsOfAssembly[label="Flavors of Assembly Language
Focus on x86 64-bit (Intel syntax).
Other CPU types: ARM, RISC-V."];SupportingMaterials[label="Supporting Materials
Limited usefulness of books/Stack Overflow.
Recommended: 'The Art of 64-bit Assembly'.
Discord server for questions."];Registers[label="Registers
CPU areas for data processing.
General Purpose Registers (GPRs): Scaffolding.
Vector Registers (SIMD): mm, xmm, ymm, zmm."];SimpleExample[label="Simple Scalar Example
Example: mov, inc, dec, imul.
Shows basic scalar operations."];SIMDFunction[label="Understanding SIMD Function
Example: add_values function.
Uses XMM registers, paddb instruction.
Load â†’ Process â†’ Store."];Title->Introduction;Introduction->RequiredKnowledge;Introduction->WhatIsAssembly;WhatIsAssembly->WhyAssembly;WhatIsAssembly->FlavorsOfAssembly;FlavorsOfAssembly->SupportingMaterials;SupportingMaterials->Registers;Registers->SimpleExample;Registers->SIMDFunction;}
